title: File-drop content is visible through the gallery app

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information:
I set up a file-drop on NC 17 (btw, according to https://nextcloud.com/security/ NC17 is not covered - but it should be once it's released!): created folder, set share as upload-only. I access that folder as https://cloud.domain.com/s/randompath - fine: I get the upload interface and cannot see what's in the folder. I (or anyone else) upload(s) something. Still fine. Now I use https://cloud.domain.com/apps/gallery/s/randompath and see everything that gallery can display. In my case, it was an upload folder for pictures, so everything is displayed (and can be downloaded, even if I set "hide download"!).

## Impact

Access all media files uploaded to a (not so secure) file-drop (https://nextcloud.com/file-drop/) folder. Could be critical in, say, a hospital, police, etc.
vulnerability_information_html:
I set up a file-drop on NC 17 (btw, according to https://nextcloud.com/security/ NC17 is not covered - but it should be once it's released!): created folder, set share as upload-only. I access that folder as https://cloud.domain.com/s/randompath - fine: I get the upload interface and cannot see what's in the folder. I (or anyone else) upload(s) something. Still fine. Now I use https://cloud.domain.com/apps/gallery/s/randompath and see everything that gallery can display. In my case, it was an upload folder for pictures, so everything is displayed (and can be downloaded, even if I set "hide download"!).

Impact

Access all media files uploaded to a (not so secure) file-drop (https://nextcloud.com/file-drop/) folder. Could be critical in, say, a hospital, police, etc.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

activities.message:
Hi @nursoda 

nice finding. can you verify that https://github.com/nextcloud/gallery/commit/f38c91cb5e056ed964a85bf13118c020d4f540d0 solves the issue?

cheers Joas

activities.message:
Congratulations! We have determined this to be eligible for a reward of $500.

Thanks a lot for making the internet a safer place and keep hacking. Please keep in mind that we didn't patch the vulnerability yet, so please do not share this information with any third-parties.

activities.message:
I confirm that the patch fixes the issue. It leads to "internal server error" though. Is that intended? Shouldn't there be a verbose warning to the user?

After applying the patch, for occ integrity:check-app gallery I expectedly get
`  - INVALID_HASH:
    - lib/Middleware/EnvCheckMiddleware.php:
      - expected: 90bccdfa0e62c3d21bf7a917fe2d2b7d018d6d88dbcd9d4a4d2d1738647491ee4baf461a756a6d2417c6e7d0d815e847cf087a702a21e56a997b61d4688f7bf7

activities.message: Yeah, of course the check fails because the file was modified, exactly what the feature reporting the issue is about. it will be fixed with the next release

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

Please let us know how you'd like to be credited in our official advisory. We require the following information:

- Name / Pseudonym
- Email address (optional)
- Website (optional)
- Company (optional)

activities.message:
You may use my clear name "Olav Seyfarth" along with my pseudonym "nursoda". Thanks!

I found and reported it as person. I'm a privacy consultant and evangelist. So there's no need to add my company, e-mail address or website mentioned, I don't want to be contacted. Hacking is not my business, I just run my own arch server, with 4 domains, each with an NC instance :-)

activities.message:
On the affected NC installation, I applied the above commit. It DID work fine. But after upgrading to latest PHP-FPM 7.3.11 and modifying nginx NC site definition according to https://nextcloud.com/blog/urgent-security-issue-in-nginx-php-fpm/ , the patched gallery app yields "internal server error" no matter whether logged in or not:

activities.message:

Usually we publish them 2-4 weeks after the release.
The release is planned for 7th November
activities.markdown_message:
ETA for that maintenance release/advisory?

Usually we publish them 2-4 weeks after the release.

activities.message: The parse error from your second comment sounds like you didnt apply the patch correctly, or it created a conflict.
activities.markdown_message: The parse error from your second comment sounds like you didnt apply the patch correctly, or it created a conflict.

activities.message:
OK, I installed 17.0.1 and verified that the fix works fine (gives proper 404 with explanation) while the app also works both for uploading and accessing the gallery. No idea what caused the above error. Thanks for all so far.

However, I was surprised to neither see it referenced in the [Changelog](https://nextcloud.com/changelog/#17-0-1) (or did I miss it?) nor on [Security Advisories](https://nextcloud.com/security/advisories/). Was that on purpose?
activities.markdown_message:
OK, I installed 17.0.1 and verified that the fix works fine (gives proper 404 with explanation) while the app also works both for uploading and accessing the gallery. No idea what caused the above error. Thanks for all so far.

However, I was surprised to neither see it referenced in the Changelog (or did I miss it?) nor on Security Advisories. Was that on purpose?

activities.message: Yes, we always publish the advisories 2-4 weeks after a release so people had time to update, before an easy attack-path is posted publicly.
activities.markdown_message: Yes, we always publish the advisories 2-4 weeks after a release so people had time to update, before an easy attack-path is posted publicly.

additional_data.old_title: file-drop folder content visible through gallery
additional_data.new_title: File-drop content is visible through the gallery app
